intro: Uvaria nudistellata, commonly known as the naked-stalked or the slender uvaria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that are often fragrant, followed by dark blue berries. It is typically found in lowland and montane forests, growing as an understory plant. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticultural and ecological studies.
